name: rooty

like a root or with a lot of roots: I had never tasted the drink before and thought that it had a rather rooty taste. Old clumps of grass can become dense and rooty, which makes them difficult to dig up.
More examplesFewer examplesThe mountain bike trail was rutted and rooty, which made the descents particularly dangerous.It's an awkward rooty position under the trees, but some plants will grow well in those conditions.A number of rooty little cuttings were laid out in the greenhouse, ready to pot up.
